text: anyone seeing incredibly low google page speed #'s on HubSpot Sites?

We have a couple clients that are getting 1/100 on mobile and other measuring tools say that the page loads within 2 seconds. Just curious if we're alone. HubSpot support doesn't provide much insight...
ive heard some of this as well. i will try to find a url.
here is one : <https://developers.google.com/speed/pagespeed/insights/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linium.com%2F&tab=mobile> (its using a site from the inspire gallery on the hs site)
looks like alot of that is due to image compression.
We've run into this with some customers as well. Clients arent too savvy when you say you need to compress images. It'd be nice to see HS integrate with an image compression service (like tinypng)
is weird though that the page ranks 75 on pingdom though
When an image is uploaded to File Manager, we strip out metadata and recompress it at 85% quality. We do not currently do any more advanced compression, but it’s something we’re looking at.
But for both of these, if the image is loaded at the appropriate resolution for the device, the scores should go up a lot
was tree view removed the website pages view?
(last sentence in the post covers it)
